candidates.title: Bump tokio to 1.17, which is current version in mozilla-central
Bump base64 and switch off default-features of nom for vendoring in m-c
Use memoffset instead of homebrew offset_of
candidates.body:
This was generating warnings/errors because the homebrew macro dereferences a null pointer and produces a reference to an unaligned field.

memoffset's implementation does this in a way that doesn't rely on UB (when building with rust >=1.51).

candidates.title: Bump sha2-version
candidates.body: mozilla-central has a newer sha2-crate vendored

candidates.title: Device selection
candidates.body:
Implement device selection, in case multiple devices are plugged in.

It is another big one, but the individual commits should be rather self-contained and easy to follow.

Big picture:
Introduced a new class, that gets created for each transaction. It will start its own thread, where an even loop is running. 
The devices run each their own thread, as well as the device monitor (as was before), but send messages to that even loop, which will then decide what to do and send commands back to the devices.

Note 1: I don't have the infra set up to compile on mac or windows, so those are best efforts. (The BSDs are currently still all broken)
Note 2: There probably is a race condition in the Mac monitor code, because I don't get all devices at the beginning in one package, but only via callbacks, which might lead to some devices being 'ignored' by the code. There probably is a way to get the list of plugged in devices from the iokit-SDK, but I'm not really a iOS-dev, nor do I have the hardware to test it.

candidates.title: Update warp and tokio
candidates.body:
This updates warp to 0.3.2 and tokio to 1.0. These libraries are only used for
testing. This update should help prevent duplicated copies of tokio when
vendoring into mozilla-central.

candidates.title: Update application-services dependency to v84.0.0
candidates.body:
Same as is vendored in mozilla-central, so that we can use this repo for vendoring.
The already vendored packages where updated while this branch was in review.

candidates.title: Add riscv64 support
candidates.body: To generate riscv64 code, rust-bindgen have to be updated due to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-bindgen/pull/1878. risc64's rust target is risc64gc-*, but clang doesn't accept this target name since correct is riscv64, not riscv64gc.
